column4: Hello everybody. i have a issue: i have a ubuntu 11.04 on my acer aspire 4736z. but somehow the monitor of my laptop is not showing. im here now because im conected by HDMI with my samsung tv.  The monitor is not dead because when im on windows the monitor is fine.  can any1 help me?
rcmaeh1: no i tryed reinstalling with my usb drive, but everytime ubuntu starts, the monitor go black... and its only black when ubuntu starts...just after boot screen
yes...i dont know if its a problem with this..because some configs are saved everyime i use the live session from the usb drive
i mean, even with the cd, or with the usb drive, my screen go black when ubuntu starts to boot...
but i can see, when i disconect HDMI that things are on screen, but too dark to see...
i burn the ubuntu 11.04 image into a cd... then using the CD live i created the usb drive by the ubuntu tool itself
rcmaeh1: yeah i tryed this..but its not a bright issue.. lokks too too dark to see.
captainkrtek:  yeah but some how did not work.
but weird becase when i boot from the usb drive, after leting my laptop off for a while, configurations like wifi network are still saved..
I am no so exp.to answer,recommend to poet in www.askubuntu.com
and another weird stuff is that sometimes when i disconected the HDMI cable, sometimes my screen appears, sometimes dont..but now its common not the appear.
anyway...can be frequency of the monitor and stuff like that?
look any same issues in Ubuntu launchpad too
